item.title: Satark Crime Mapper
item.description: Satark is a digital crime recording and analytics web application built for performing real time spatial data analysis on crime data to help the police personnels identify crime hotspots and prevailing crime trends. The application was conceived as a solution to the problem statement of crime mapping offered by the Govt of Assam during the Smart India Hackathon ’18. It composed of three major components A database management system for recording geospatial crime data built using postgreSQL.

item.title: Satark Crime Mapper and SIH 2018
item.description: (Disclaimer: The data used for this application is synthetic. I’ve used London city’s data and modified it by randomly attaching districts, geolocation, victim_age etc. The crime records reported in the application are in no way related to Assam.) During the Smart India Hackathon 2018, I got a chance to make an interactive ‘Crime Mapper and Spatial data analytics tool’. My team, Six Sigma, named it ‘SATARK’. The code is entirely written in R and I’ve used R’s ‘Shiny’ package to build it into an interactive app.
